thread.title: Brazil freezes $2.5 bln in gov't expenses on Eletrobras uncertainty

title: Brazil freezes $2.5 bln in gov't expenses on Eletrobras uncertainty
text:
42 PM / Updated 8 minutes ago Brazil freezes $2.5 bln in gov't expenses on Eletrobras uncertainty Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
BRASILIA, Feb 2 (Reuters) - Brazil on Friday froze 8 billion reais ($2.5 billion) worth of government expenses for this year under a revised budget to account for potential delays in a plan to privatize power utility Centrais Elétricas Brasileiras SA . 
Policymakers expect to raise 12.2 billion reais with the privatization of Eletrobras, as the power utility is known. The revised budget forecasts a 2018 primary deficit of 154.8 billion reais before interest rate payments, below the deficit target of 159 billion reais, Planning Minister Dyogo Oliveira said in a news conference. $1 = 3.21 reais Reporting by Marcela Ayres; Writing by Bruno Federowski Editing by Chizu Nomiyama
